main event: On October 3, 1952, in Morristown, Tennessee, approximately 100 to 150 factory workers witnessed a round transparent object with a smoke trail flying at an altitude of about two to three thousand feet. The object traveled at a speed similar to that of a transport plane in a straight flight pattern before disappearing from sight.
interesting points: The object was described as a round, clear transparent object with a smoke trail, and it flew at a speed similar to that of a transport plane.
The sighting involved approximately 100 to 150 factory workers, making it a large-scale observation.
One plant manager speculated that the object might have been a 'Jet-plane' but declined to confirm due to eyesight issues.
There were assessments and questions about the presence of air traffic in the area at the time of the sighting, but no concrete evidence was presented.
The observation was made in a clear sky, and the winds aloft and general weather conditions were reported as unknown.
sighted object: Round transparent object with a smoke trail
